faqs.question: Does OpenObserve offer a free tier?
faqs.answer: Yes, OpenObserve offers a free tier that includes a limited amount of log storage and ingestion. It's ideal for small projects, testing, or evaluation purposes. Usage beyond the free tier will require a paid plan.

faqs.question: What are the available pricing plans?
faqs.answer:
OpenObserve offers flexible pricing plans:
  • Free Tier: Basic features with limited storage and ingestion rate.
  • Standard: Includes higher retention, alerts, and dashboard features.
  • Enterprise: Advanced analytics, extended retention, custom integrations, and premium support.

faqs.question: How is pricing calculated?
faqs.answer: Pricing is typically based on data ingestion volume (e.g., GB/day), retention period, and feature set. Some plans may include limits on dashboard usage, queries, or team members.

faqs.question: What happens when I exceed the limits of my plan?
faqs.answer: If you exceed your planâ€™s ingestion or storage limits, overage charges may apply, or your data ingestion may be throttled. You can upgrade your plan at any time to avoid service disruption.

faqs.question: Is there a trial available for premium features?
faqs.answer: Yes, OpenObserve provides a free trial of premium features so users can evaluate the platform before committing to a paid plan. You can enable the trial from your dashboard.

faqs.question: Can I change my plan later?
faqs.answer: Yes, plans are flexible. You can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your subscription at any time through the billing settings in your account.

faqs.question: Does OpenObserve offer usage-based billing?
faqs.answer: Yes, OpenObserve supports usage-based billing, which means you only pay for the data you ingest and store. This helps optimize cost for varying workloads.

faqs.question: Are there discounts for startups or non-profits?
faqs.answer: OpenObserve offers discounts for eligible startups, educational institutions, and non-profit organizations. You can contact the sales team to apply for special pricing.
